metadata.title: CVE-2022-4883 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in libXpm. When processing files with .Z or .gzextensions, the library calls external programs to compress and uncompressfiles, relying on the PATH environment variable to find these programs,which could allow a malicious user to execute other programs bymanipulating the PATH environment variable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxpm4 - 1:3.5.11-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
xpmutils - 1:3.5.11-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libxpm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.5.11-1ubuntu0.16.04.1+esm1').
motif package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
